name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Data Center Fiber Optic & Structured Cabling Technician
professional_summary: Hands-on Data Center Fiber Optic & Cabling Technician with 6+ years of experience working in Tier III colocation facilities supporting mission-critical fiber and copper infrastructure.
Expertise in MTP/MPO trunk installations, SC/LC connector terminations, and strict adherence to TIA-568 and TIA-942 data center standards.
Proficient in fiber inspection using VFL and OPM tools, cable dressing per bend radius requirements, and maintaining proper cable management in hot/cold aisle containment environments.
Known for delivering clean, well-documented installations while following OSHA safety protocols, MOPs (Method of Procedures), and client-specific SLAs in live production environments.
core_skills: Overhead Cable Tray, Ladder Rack & J-Hook Routing
Data Center Change Management & Ticketing Systems
daily_activities: Inspecting fiber end-faces using fiber microscopes and cleaning with IPA wipes and click cleaners
Installing MTP/MPO and LC/SC fiber runs per customer cabling matrices and port assignments
Labeling cables on both A-end and B-end using Brady flag labelers per client labeling schemas
Routing fiber and CAT6 through overhead ladder racks, cable trays, and J-hooks while maintaining proper bend radius (10x cable diameter)
Performing fiber continuity testing with VFL (Visual Fault Locator) and power measurements with OPM
Troubleshooting connectivity issues, repatching cross-connects, and re-terminating damaged connectors
Dressing and Velcro-strapping cables in vertical and horizontal pathways to ensure proper airflow and aesthetics
Executing MOPs during scheduled maintenance windows in live production environments

responsibilities: Inspected fiber end-faces using Fluke fiber microscopes and cleaned connectors with IPA wipes and click cleaners to achieve <-40dB insertion loss per TIA standards.
Installed pre-terminated MTP/MPO trunk cables and LC/SC fiber patch cables according to customer cabling matrices, ensuring proper A-end to B-end connectivity for cross-connect orders.
Labeled fiber and CAT6 cables on both ends using Brady and Brother flag labelers, maintaining strict adherence to client-specific labeling schemas (e.g., rack.U.port format).
Routed cabling through overhead ladder racks, cable trays, and J-hooks while maintaining 10x bend radius compliance and proper cable management for optimal airflow in hot/cold aisle containment.
Performed fiber continuity testing using VFL (Visual Fault Locator) and power loss measurements with OPM (Optical Power Meter) to verify link quality before customer handoff.
Troubleshot and resolved fiber connectivity issues by re-terminating LC/SC connectors, repatching cross-connects in MMR (Meet-Me Room), and coordinating with NOC teams.
Secured and dressed fiber and CAT6 cabling using Velcro straps and cable management accessories to ensure clean, organized installations per Equinix aesthetic and operational standards.
Executed MOPs (Method of Procedures) during scheduled maintenance windows, coordinating with lead techs and following strict change management protocols to minimize downtime.
Assisted with cabinet builds, rack-and-stack operations, and infrastructure upgrades in live Tier III colocation environments supporting 99.982% uptime SLAs.
Maintained DCIM (Data Center Infrastructure Management) documentation and updated ticketing systems (ServiceNow) with accurate cable records and completion notes.
Followed OSHA safety protocols, hot aisle access procedures, ESD precautions, and customer escort policies while working in shared colocation spaces.
Supported structured cabling installations (fiber & CAT6) for data center network infrastructure projects across Tier II and Tier III colocation facilities.
Routed and secured fiber and copper cables through overhead cable trays, vertical and horizontal pathways, and conduit systems following TIA-568 standards and client specifications.
Conducted cable continuity testing using network cable testers (Fluke LinkRunner) and fiber testing tools to verify connectivity and signal integrity after installation.
Assisted with labeling and documentation of installed cables using flag labelers, maintaining accurate as-built records for client handover and future maintenance operations.
Performed cable dressing and Velcro-strapping in server racks and network cabinets, ensuring proper cable management, bend radius compliance, and accessibility for future modifications.
Supported cross-connect installations in MMR (Meet-Me Room) environments, coordinating with network engineers and following customer port assignment matrices.
Maintained organized cabling layouts in IDF/MDF (Intermediate/Main Distribution Frame) closets and colocation cages per data center standards.
